definition: Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera

sentences.english: There is no gainsaying his innocence.
She had lived blamelessly until she met this man.
sentences.chinese: 在遇到这个男人以前，她一直清清白白地生活着。

sentences.english: Tian Xin tell Tang Li fields with death in the day to prove his innocence.
sentences.chinese: 田心告诉唐力田在天要以死来证明自己的清白。

sentences.english: The strangest thing about it is that really hones people are often made to feel guilty.
sentences.chinese: 最不可思议的是，清白的人往往会被搞得有负罪感。

sentences.english: The chairman's lawyer has declared that his client is innocent.
sentences.chinese: 但森西的律师坚持称，他的委托人是清白的。

sentences.english: An innocent plowman is more worthy than a vicious prince.
sentences.chinese: 一个邪恶的王子不如一个清白的庄稼汉有价值。

sentences.english: I have no doubt whatever about his innocence.
sentences.chinese: 我一点都不怀疑他的清白。

sentences.english: Why not assume that your experience is innocent until proven guilty?
sentences.chinese: 为何不在你的经历被证明有罪之前假设它是清白的？

sentences.english: He looked forward to starting life again with a clean slate.
sentences.chinese: 他期望清清白白地重新开始生活。

sentences.english: Amazingly he was granted parole because sufficient doubt remained about his innocence.
sentences.chinese: 戏剧性的是他被准予假释，因为许多人相信他的清白。

sentences.english: Come away with innocence, and leave me with my sins.
sentences.chinese: 带着清白远走高飞，带着我的罪恶离我远去。

sentences.english: I have never had a rap sheet and my record is clean.
sentences.chinese: 我从来没有犯过事，清清白白。

sentences.english: I certify on my honour that she is innocent.
sentences.chinese: 我用人格担保她是清白无辜的。

sentences.english: As depicted online, the grass-mud horse seems innocent enough at the start.
sentences.chinese: 最初在网上的描述中，“草泥马”似乎足够清白。

sentences.english: He must be ecstatic about your exoneration.
sentences.chinese: 他得知你恢复清白身一定很兴奋。

sentences.english: A man is accounted innocent to the time of he is proven guilty.
sentences.chinese: 唯一人未被证明有罪前，被视为是清白的。

definition: variant of 污衊|污蔑[wu1 mie4]
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
variant of 誣衊|诬蔑[wu1 mie4]
to offer an explanation/to plead innocence/to try to defend oneself
to reverse a verdict/to present different views on a historical person or verdict
to discredit/to defame/to smear sb's name/to bring shame upon (oneself or one's family etc)/to blacken (e.g. commando's face for camouflage)/to black out or obliterate (e.g. censored words)
to expose/to bring to light/to disclose/revelation
